(yes, this is officially the trigger point of a minor derail)
i havent seen anything pointing to a no, but then again you have the whole radiation shebang to deal with :)

If you are on a good connection with the US west coast, which I assume Japan will have, you can expect pings of around 250ms or so, at that latency I've never felt at a disadvantage, even on eq2 which tended to always be over 300ms.  It never stopped me from topping dps parses at least.

Smuggler/BH = Ranged DPS or DPS/support heals
Trooper/agent = Ranged dps/heals or ranged tanking

Been lurking the TOR forums, i forgot what the mix of gamers and fanboys is like. This is going to be an interesting game.
Updated details from Devs:

I'd like to recap on a few other key questions and answers:
There are no plans to 'region lock' or 'IP block' players from the game. You may experience some latency issues if you're not playing in a launch territory.
Anyone who pre-orders The Old Republic and redeems their pre-order code will be eligible for Early Game Access.
Those eligible for Early Game Access will be able to download the game client before it starts.
There will be a period after launch day in which those who have pre-ordered will be able to continue playing before entering their Game Code. More information on this will be made available closer to launch.
We will accept credit card payments for subscriptions.

Devs are starting guild beta testing. There is no application, they are picking at random. Pop onto the guild forums here http://www.swtor.com/guilds/30760/tempest/public-forum and make some activity. Probably won't help but it can't hurt.
